projectDesc.p: This document is part of a larger digital collection of stories of ghost hoaxes from the 18th and 19th century British newspapers and periodicals. The project explores the beginnings of mass print media in metropolitan areas at a time when technology and education made reading for pleasure common and inexpensive.

body.p: There is one of the most remarkable personifications— if such a term may be allowed— of a Ghost, in the singular story of The Robber, which has just appeared from the pen of Blackwood's well-known contributor. The schemes of the Robber are most ingeniously and naturally contrived to depend, for their fulfillment, almost upon a miracle; and it is the phantom-stratagem which he practices, that most marvelously works out his security, and eventually his doom.
